text: Park Yong-ju ( born May 22, 1994), better known by his stage name Yongzoo, is a South Korean singer and songwriter signed to Mostworks Entertainment. He debuted with the song "In Your Eyes" on May 22, 2018. ==Early life and career== ===2012–2016=== Park Yong-ju had trained for three years in SM Entertainment, the leading entertainment agency in South Korea. He later became an associate member of the company's pre-debut training team SM Rookies with the stage name "Yongju", although he did not get officially introduced. His only documented activity with the pre-debut team was a performance in "SM Town Week" in 2013 alongside the now-NCT members. Park participated as a contestant in a boy group survival reality show named Super Idol (season 1 and 2), which is co-hosted by China's Anhui Satellite TV and South Korea's MBC Music TV. In the final of the season 1, his team "B Swan" won the show's champion. And later in the final of the season 2, he became the first winner of the show and also won a debut quota as a member of a new boy group. ===2017–present=== In 2017, Park started to use the stage name Jhomie to launch songs. He collaborated with music composer Ferdy in "Ferdy's Project". They launched 2 songs on August 2017 and in January 2018. The first single in "Ferdy's Project vol.1" is named "See the Light", which is released on August 2017. In addition to participate the vocal part, Park also took part in the lyrics creation. In January 2018, they released "Ferdy's Project vol.2". The single is named "At That Place". In addition to participate in the vocal part, he also took part in the creations of melody and lyrics. Park is signed to MostWorks Entertainment as a solo artist and debuted on May 22, 2018 with stage name Yongzoo (용주). Since his debut, he participated in soundtracks for television dramas including Are You Human? and The Third Charm. ==Discography== ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="1" style="width:5em;" | Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Sales |- !
